title: Married At First Sight's Nasser Sultan debuts shocking new tattoo in Bali
text:
It's been two years since Nasser Sultan filmed his season of Married At First Sight.

But his legacy as a reality star will now last forever, thanks to a permanent tattoo he had inked across his chest in Bali on Tuesday.

The 52-year-old had the word 'celebrity' tattooed on his chest alongside a blue tick.

What a brilliant idea! Nasser Sultan's legacy as a reality star will now last forever, thanks to a permanent tattoo he had inked across his chest in Bali on Tuesday

The blue tick is a reference to the symbol used by Instagram to show that a person's account has been verified by the site's administrators.

The verification system allows high-profile users, including celebrities and politicians, to show that their account is genuine.

For months, Nasser had battled with the social media giant for blue tick verification, before eventually being granted it in August.

That's clever! Nasser, 52, had the word 'celebrity' tattooed on his chest alongside a blue tick

Nasser revealed he got the tattoo because he is 'Australia's biggest celebrity' and he wants people to know.

In footage obtained by Daily Mail Australia, Nasser can be heard telling the tattoo artist what design he wants and explaining how famous he is back home.

'You know who I am, don't you?' he asks, as the man shaves his chest area.

That makes sense! Nasser revealed he got the tattoo because he is 'Australia's biggest celebrity' and he wants people to know

Excellent work! After getting his tattoo, Nasser posed with the artists in their Kuta studio

'Big celebrity from Australia and best in Bali!' the tattoo artist responds, looking rather confused.

Nasser rose to fame on season four of Married At First Sight in early 2018, before later appearing as a plaintiff on Channel 10's Trial by Kyle.

He has also filmed an episode of First Dates, which will air on Seven next year.

Remember them? Nasser rose to fame on season four of Married At First Sight in early 2018. Pictured with his 'wife' Gabrielle Bartlett, who is no longer famous
description: Nasser Sultan's legacy as a reality star will now last forever, thanks to a permanent tattoo he had inked across his chest in Bali on Tuesday
authors: Joshua Fox For Daily Mail Australia
